website_summaries.verdict: For really moist environments, this dehumidifier delivers on removing a lot of water from the air.
pros: Can operate continuously when placed over a drain
Designed to pull 95 pints of water a day out of the air
Comes with a longer power cord
Can bring humidity levels way down compared to other dehumidifiers
cons: If you're planning to use the bucket function, be aware it's only slightly larger than a gallon – smaller than others on the market

customer_reviews.title: they said a sensor has gone bad and although there is a 5 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in June 2015, in May of 2017 it came up with an error code. Called customer service, they said a sensor has gone bad and although there is a 5 year warranty, the sensor is not covered. Now we are purchasing a new dehumidifier. I will NEVER EVER purchase a Frigidaire product again. Junk!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ott

customer_reviews.title: This is what you need
customer_reviews.text: I received this unit 4 days ago, so far it has done excellent. I put it in my basement and it has dried the entire basement up. I had water dripping off the cold water lines, wet spots in the concrete floor and that old wet basement smell, all of which is now gone and in 4 days. It brought the humidity down from 70% to 40%. All i can say is wow!!! If you need a dehumidifier you need to get this one!! Update 3years 9 months later, no issues at all this unit is still going strong as it did the first day i recieved it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McPeake

customer_reviews.title: Dreaded FO Changing my rating to 1 Star from 5
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Sept 2018 in May 2020 dreaded FO code appeared. These units are designed to fail after their 1yr warranty-it’s all over the internet. Expensive to buy, a new one after only 18 months of use is $553 Buy a service plan. FO is common on Frigidaire and you’ll be told it’s cheaper to buy a new one than repair. FAD954DWD dehumidifier- very disappointed in the life of this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L Garrigan

customer_reviews.title: So far so good for 2 months in the basement replacing LG 75 ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good for 2 months in the basement replacing LG 75 pint dehumidifier which I used for 8 years. This is lot more powerful dehumidifier and works very well to maintain 50% humidity level in my 1500 square feet basement in New Jersey. Operation noise is quiet than LG and I hope it lasts long. I need the dehumidifier thru June - September only because it drops to 45% after October. But it is needed during the summer to lower the humidity to maintain lots of book and equipment I have in the basement. Books last much longer when the humidity is low in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: chong soo cho

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the extra money i paid thinking i was getting a good one.
customer_reviews.text: I get code F0 and Figidaire says it is not cost effective to fix this unit, and that i should replace it. I bought it july 29th 2015 so i got 1 1/2 summers out of it. Not worth the extra money i paid thinking i was getting a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Sandbothe

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly - for less than 12 months!
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly - but for less than 12 months total. We purchased in late August 2016, so it ran for about 3 months till no longer needed. Then, it worked all Spring/Summer/Fall of 2017 (we live in mid-west where humidity starts at about April and ends about Sept/Oct). THEN stopped. We could not get it started for this Spring 2018. "FO" in display. Called Frigidaire CS and followed their instructions, unplugging, restarting, etc. This didn't work. The cost to ship back for repairs would be about the same as buying another.
customer_reviews.author: vict

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit based on good reviews and the size of the unit. We are on our 3rd one so far in less than 3 years. Unit runs fine for the first couple of months but freezes up. Will not pull the humidity down but runs the power bill up! Wish they would just send me a product that works without having to replace it every year.
customer_reviews.author: Sim Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Dehumidifer in 2015. Really worked well in basement. kept it dry and air felt clean. worked well until 2019 when got the dreaded FO error code. Frigidaire Customer services was no help since was out of warranty. After spending over 350$ on this, was very hard to purchase a replacement. Be sure to but the extended warranty
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this product for a month or two and it works well. My basement is running at 41% in the very humid part of summer in KC. Had a little trouble connecting the drain hose without getting a leak but that problem was resolved by using an inexpensive short garden hose with a new washer. No leaks now!
customer_reviews.author: HuskerFan

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit since the summer of 2017. It is much quieter than the unit it replaced. Based on my wall mounted hygrometer, it does a good job of maintaining a humidity level--much better than the unit it replaced. I have it connected to a hose, do there's no tank to empty--just need to clean the filter from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Topken

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful, very nice
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a humidifier that works well enough to handle my 2000 sq ft office. It was built in 1840 and had some moisture problems. I set this to always run, and put it on a power timer for twice a day for 30 minutes. It's not too loud in this super quiet place, and with the condensate pump I bought, I don't have to dump water.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Turke

customer_reviews.title: Fine dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to dry out a crawl space for a perimeter drain. Ran for 14 days no break went from 98% down to 30% with 6 days of rain.Kow it just has to do the house in the summer
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Died after 1 and 1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: When it works, its works great, quiet, powerful and perfect for our house. Unfortunately, its a sealed system and when it looses its freon its very hard to service. Frigidaire won't repair them and they only have a 1 year warranty. Mine lost its gas after 1 and 1/2 years and is now a $400 land fill item. They don't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Colin T. Cassells

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S. for a larger Dehumidifier
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 years of only being used in the summer before the dreaded "F0" showed up. To be honest for the cost, you are better off buying 2 smaller units and placing them in different locations. For a 95 pint dehumidifier I thought it lacked the dehumidifying power you'd expect. Can't really say anything good about it. Big, expensive, under performed, and broke.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P.

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my basement. Hooked up the hose (not included) and I don’t need to worry about it.
customer_reviews.author: Yorkiedog

customer_reviews.title: Water Tank Capacity is SMALL!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the unit so I could remove the maximum amount of moister. I figured the 95 pint would be great, however, the water tank capacity is smaller than even my 50 pint dehumidifier.....Now I have to empty the tank three times as often which defeated the purpose of the 95 pint version.
customer_reviews.author: Becke

customer_reviews.title: I'm so happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I had a 70 Pint Dehumidifier in my 800sq ft basement, but my humidity level was still averaging around 58%. Since I've plugged in the Frigidaire FAD954DWD 95 Pint Dehumidifier, the humidity level has been around 35%. I'm so happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Edith

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in it's performance and would return it if I ...
customer_reviews.text: This dehumidifier did not deliver...at all. Based on the size of the room, I was very disappointed in it's performance and would return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Be the Change

customer_reviews.title: A good product line
customer_reviews.text: This unit is functioning well -- so far. It is doing the job and is doing it quietly.
customer_reviews.author: WLJ

customer_reviews.title: Last long enough to get past warranty time.
customer_reviews.text: Barely lasted 1 yr and 1/2. When it worked it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: I have a 2500 sq. ft. unfinished basement ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2500 sq.ft. unfinished basement open floor plan. I set it so that the humidity would stay below 50 percent and it has in June, July, Aug. and now in Dec. 35% and does not turn on. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond M.

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Purchased July 2017 Died April 2019. Fan runs but compressor never comes on. Piece of JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: JohnAClark

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. Works just like the instructions say for it to. I would buy this product again from this seller!
customer_reviews.author: TLP

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Frigidaire dehumidifiers!!! I've numerous under ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy Frigidaire dehumidifiers!!! I've numerous under a year then you have to fight the company to get it replaced which the never do!!!

customer_reviews.title: This unit worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This unit worked better than expected! We're using it in a 2,000 square foot warehouse space. The humidity was 80% when before we bought it. Now it's 55%. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Beaucher

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly to keep our basement family room dry and ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly to keep our basement family room dry and fresh smelling! FYI-Did not include drainage line - must be purchased separately
customer_reviews.author: sue zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Unit FAILED in only 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit based off great reviews Worked fine for 3 months then failed. Contacted Frigidaire customer service & they were very helpful in initiating an "automatic buyback". Seems this is not an uncommon problem for this unit. We will be shopping for another new dehumidifier soon. Not sure if we'll go with this brand again. Gave 2 stars only because they did have great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN J NOVAK

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I'm afraid I am one of the purchaser that the unit last 5 months. Buy at your own risk. There is no support from Frigidaire if unit fails, they just run you around in circles.
customer_reviews.author: clifford D Gray

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great just wish the bucket for the water was larger.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I waited so long to purchase a dehumidifier. I can not tell enough the difference after a heavy or constant rain with the smell, seepage & moisture within my basement. This unit is mighty powerful and does a wonderful job. With it's direct hose drain (hose not included), never have to worry about running downstairs to empty. The basement is dry as a bone within 36 to 48 hours. Don't think I could have purchased a better unit.
customer_reviews.author: sk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great takes care of my lower area 2500 SqFt.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: performing as described and highly recommend; fairly quiet for capacity
customer_reviews.author: David F. Carver

customer_reviews.title: Wasting money , worst customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of this unit last year , it stopped working after using for couple months , called customers service and never got a replacement that I promised . Even though i had this bad experience with first one , while waiting for reimbursement, I bought the second one which stopped working in two months as well. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY !!
customer_reviews.author: Cemal YILMAZ

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job, not extremely heavy
customer_reviews.text: Small 2.5" crack on the side of the catch tray/pan but doesn't effect usage and not noticeable unless you're staring at it from a back angle. Does a great job, not extremely heavy, solid coasters and easy to use. Solid price for a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... a 65 pint lg with this and tjis is amazing. Really dries up the basement when the old ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 65 pint lg with this and tjis is amazing. Really dries up the basement when the old one struggled.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sarnocinski

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the first 2 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first 2 MONTHS. Stopped pulling water in after 2 moths of light usage. Amazon came to rescue as usual. Stay away from all the 95 pint dehumidifiers ( Frigidaire, Whynter RPD-951DXP and Soleus Home Comfort #BDA95) They all seem to have the same design and probably use the same internal part from Gree which created a fire hazard recall a few years ago.
customer_reviews.author: East Coast Man

customer_reviews.title: Dried up a Forepeake
customer_reviews.text: We are currently running two of these, in a forpeake of a barge, that runs constantly offshore in the Gulf of Mexico. Had a very bad problem with condensation sweating....bow was like a swamp. Just wanted to try two of these, to see if it helped. 3000 square foot space, all steel, 10 foot high overhead, with numerous hatches...that we open and close. Installed, and problem cleared right up. They do a really good job completely drying up the space. We have had them for 3 months now, still running strong...in one of the harshest environments you could imagine. We do not expect much out of household appliances out here, but these are hanging tough.
customer_reviews.author: Dugboat

customer_reviews.title: Best I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I have a large house with a damp basement. My previous dehumidifiers have always kept the RH at 60%. Barely acceptable. This year I thought I'd get two units to solve the problem. So far this single unit has kept the basement at 45 - 48% RH. Just about perfect. And it's quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Cannan

customer_reviews.title: Energy efficient
customer_reviews.text: This Frigidaire unit does an excellent job. I have it used in the main part of my house which is 2000 sq ft which includes upstairs hallway and has easily maintained set humidity level. My home is mostly open area which probably makes for ease of maintaining a set level. One thing I do not like is that is does not automatically shut down when a set level has been established, fan runs, but would prefer unit to shutdown. It does have timer, which I have not used. Unit is noisy even when set on lowest speed. But I gave 5 stars because the unit does an excellent job of removing moisture, very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry, AL

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it's only been a week since I received this unit but it's doing great. The reviews on it were so-so. It replaces the SPT 65 pint unit I bought from Amazon a few years ago. That was a piece of crap right from the start, should have sent it back. It ran in defrost mode more than dehumidifier mode. This Frigidaire 95 is super quiet with 3 speeds and hasn't frozen up at all, It's in a large basement. I took the extra 3 year plan just in case, it is so inexpensive. I will add to this review when a few months go by.
customer_reviews.author: R. M.

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Like other dehumidifiers I have purchased in the past ten years, this worked great for the first nine months, but no longer functions correctly. The filter is clean, and the fan and compressor cycle on as expected. I believe this is a refrigerant issue but I'm not qualified to service the sealed system (and Frigidaire advises that their units are not serviceable). I used the unit in my 1300 sqft home in the main living area, so I don't believe that the conditions caused undue stress on the unit. Customer service from Frigidaire was great, however I am frustrated that I cannot find a dehumidifier that I can depend on for more than a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Nick G

customer_reviews.title: The dehumidifiers seem to be working great but the hose attachment is terrible
customer_reviews.text: The dehumidifiers seem to be working great but the hose attachment is terrible. I bought two of these and both of the hose adapters leaked. One started leaking right away and I had to use flex seal on both to stop it. The other one didn't start leaking until the next day and once again, it wasn't until I sprayed the adapter with flex seal did the leak stop. I am trying to dry out my house post Hurricane Harvey and the last thing I needed was a leaky dehumidifier.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Bachman

customer_reviews.title: Dehumidify your basement to a livable, fresh air room.
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing 2 Frigidaire 70 pint I purchased the 95 it works great! Brought the basement humidity down faster than anticipated using the adjustable control panel. Easy external hose attachment allows you to not empty daily. Eliminating the pump eliminates the problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Julian

customer_reviews.title: High Volume, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: THIS has finally dried my swamp of a basement out. I have tried several other dehumidifiers over the past several years and none could keep up. This dried the air within 3 days and has maintained for months since. Reasonably quiet, return air comes out the top rather than side like most.
customer_reviews.author: MakeWinesNotWar

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 2 seasons, then F0 error - but Frigidaire replaced it under warranty!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 2 summers. Now when I turn it on, after trying to work for about half an hour, F0 code appears on the display and it shuts off. Update: Called Frigidaire and they replaced the entire unit under the "sealed system" warranty period, at no cost to me.
customer_reviews.author: Donald G May

customer_reviews.title: So far 1-Month it's working great. Basement is 3000 square feet went from 60 ...
customer_reviews.text: So far 1-Month it's working great. Basement is 3000 square feet went from 60 degree Humidity to 45 in a couple of days. I have a hose draining it into my sump pump.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS R. KING

customer_reviews.title: Guess I didn't understand the sizing.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would hold more water than the 50 pint size but it was smaller. Sent it back since the 50 pint did an outstanding job for us.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Great product and value
customer_reviews.text: This pulls a massive amount of moisture from the air. Great product!! The price was a so very reasonable compared to big box stores
customer_reviews.author: kara evans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Tried 2 from menards and both sucked. This one is perfect. Nothing more to say. Started to have problems before the first year was up. Called Amazon and they sent out another one right away. Second one has been great for years now.
customer_reviews.author: deanna

customer_reviews.title: BAD PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: DONOT get this product was under warranty and could not get anyone to work on this item. I would go with another name brand.
customer_reviews.author: backpacker

customer_reviews.title: It had several modes of operation that are easy to select
customer_reviews.text: The unit works very effectively at reducing and controlling the humidity in my basement. It had several modes of operation that are easy to select, but I found it confusing when I wanted to manually set the humidity level.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: stinky and hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: after 2 years it smells like dead fish and you cannot have it serviced under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: IBuyAlot

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome. Much quieter than the 50-pint unit
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a recalled Frigidaire 50-pint unit with this 95-pint unit. It is awesome. Much quieter than the 50-pint unit, and runs much less. The top exhaust is much handier and the filter is much easier to remove for cleaning. Our old 50-pint was several years old, and was still working when it was recalled, so I expect the same reliability from this new unit. By the way, we received a check reimbursing us for nearly the entire purchase price of the 50-pint unit as result of the recall. I highly recommend the Frigidaire 95-pint unit.
customer_reviews.author: Charla D.

customer_reviews.title: TIME WILL TELL
customer_reviews.text: UP AND RUNNING :I LIKE WHAT I SEE SO FAR:
customer_reviews.author: LWIS4966

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device to have in a humid summer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device to have in a humid summer. I bought this, increase the temperature in the house 5 degrees and reduce my power bill $$
customer_reviews.author: F. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: easy to operate and a workhorse
customer_reviews.text: Quiet when compared to other units, easy to operate and a workhorse.
customer_reviews.author: Gum

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: had it three weeks and it appears to be working very well
customer_reviews.author: FishusT

customer_reviews.title: Initially, the float to activate bucket-full-switch was loosely inside ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially, the float to activate bucket-full-switch was loosely inside the bucket - not installed. Turned power switch on but unit won't operate (P2 error indicating bucket is full. Installed float, then the unit has been working since. Suggestion: install float at the factory then tape for transit rather than leaving it off.
customer_reviews.author: Don A.

customer_reviews.title: I was really surprised because the product had such great reviews but it didn't work for me I kept ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for two months and it stopped working.I was really surprised because the product had such great reviews but it didn't work for me I kept turning on and turning off and turning on and turning off I tried unplugging it and plugging it back in and work the bucket was empty I don't know what to sa I was really surprised because the product had such great reviews but it didn't work for me I kept turning on and turning off and turning on and turning off I tried unplugging it and plugging it back in it worth the bucket was empty. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: C. Lightfoot

customer_reviews.title: Thils unit DIED after 4 months of use, and apparently they are only good for once season;  BUYER BEWARE ...... real rip off !!
customer_reviews.text: Thils unit DIED after 4 months of use, and the cost of replacing the humidistat with the hope that it might come back to life is probably not worth the trouble. If you want to take a chance, be sure to buy all the extra warrantee coverage you can get !!
customer_reviews.author: R.H.

customer_reviews.title: clears out humidity fast
customer_reviews.text: product worked ok, but I am still waiting for it to dry out the molding. it does take out more humidity than my 50 pit old dehumidifier.
customer_reviews.author: tom anthony

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY REFURB FROM "GOOD GUYS."
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY REFURB FROM GOOD GUYS. My unit broke after less than a year, and after three attempts to contact them - including Amazon's attempt at intervening - they would not offer more than an incomplete sentence saying I'm out of the 30 day warranty period. Maybe that works for them ($$) but buyer beware - these units will break quickly, and you will be left holding the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Tilden

customer_reviews.title: Great dehumidifier!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! This started removing moisture from my basement immediately. I have it set up in the middle of my basement and it seems to reduce moisture throughout the whole basement. Definitely need to make sure you hook a hose up for the water drain. Otherwise, you will be emptying the bucket every couple of hours.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Iced up and failed at 5 months due to system leak and subsequent low refrigerant levels
customer_reviews.text: The unit failed at 5 months due to low refrigerant levels heralded by significant evaporator and suction line ice formation and subsequent lack of dehumidification. Low temperature thermistor tested OK. Since unit is under warranty, contact was made with Frigidaire who indicated that they would provide a buy-back, i.e. a VISA debit card loaded with an unspecified amount of cash. They did not require that the unit be returned. It remains to be seen if the Frigidaire warranty provides adequate compensation for a unit that was well maintained but failed nonetheless after only 5 months of service.
customer_reviews.author: D. DeNucci

product_meta.title: Frigidaire FAD954DWD Dehumidifier, 95-Pint, White
product_meta.description: The Frigidaire 95-pint dehumidifier protects your home from mold and mildew caused by excess moisture. It also helps eliminate bacteria in the air that can make breathing difficult. Frigidaire's 95 pints-per-day dehumidifier is capable of continuous operation when the unit is located near a suitable drain. It features full-function electronic controls, an easily accessible collection container with level indicator and a washable filter that reduces bacteria, room odors and other airborne particles. Its effortless humidity control allows you to control the exact percentage of humidity in your room. The SpaceWise portable design includes integrated side handles and caster wheels making it easy to move your unit from room to room.
feature_bullets: Protects your home from mold and mildew caused by excess moisture
Helps eliminate bacteria in the air that can make breathing difficult
Continuous operation is possible when unit is located near a suitable drain
Front; pull-out tank with handle and splash guard
Extra long 6 feet three-prong power cord makes extension cords unnecessary.Continuously drains your dehumidifier – so you don’t have to empty the water bucket.
Certifications & Approvals: ENERGY STAR Certified: No|Safety Certification: UL/CUL|UL Listed: Yes|NSF Certified: No|ETL Listed: No|CSA Listed: No

General Specs: Refrigerant: R410a|Warranty: 1 Year Full/5 Year Sealed System|Shipping Weight (lbs): 80|Product Weight (lbs): 69|Reconditioned: No|ProductLaunch: NA|Power Type: Electric|Size: N/A|Installation Type: Free-Standing|Collection: Frigidaire
